snippet: Mitt Romney is in reach of the Republican presidential nomination, but he cannot escape the “severely conservative” path he took to get it.
abstract: Editorial contends that Mitt Romney, having achieved a definitive lead in the Republican primary, must attempt to repair the damage done by his extremist statements on birth control, immigration and other controversial topics; holds that the general electorate is unlikely to forget the harsh conservatism he has espoused for months, or to go along with his budget-slashing outlook in a time of great economic distress.
lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney is in reach of the Republican presidential nomination, but he cannot escape the “severely conservative” path he took to get it.
